abstract.p: Rakesh Rajani letter notes that most of fighters in Sierra Leone are children and young people, and that achieving peace will require provision of meaningful opportunities for them (S)

block.p: Michael Ignatieff (Op-Ed, May 15) calls for ''crushing force'' to ''crush the rebels'' in Sierra Leone. But a majority of the rebels are children and young people barely out of their teens, who fight evil wars for lack of viable options. Surely killing them is unacceptable.

Michael Ignatieff (Op-Ed, May 15) calls for ''crushing force'' to ''crush the rebels'' in Sierra Leone. But a majority of the rebels are children and young people barely out of their teens, who fight evil wars for lack of viable options. Surely killing them is unacceptable.

While the half-baked Security Council response is woefully inadequate, overwhelming violent force is not what is needed. Achieving peace and human rights in Sierra Leone will require something much more serious, including the provision of meaningful opportunities for its youth.
The writer is a research fellow at Harvard.
